Commit Message: Initial commit
First working version

README: upload casing in PyPI links

Use the canonical casing.
aria2: fix typo affecting downloads to pwd
version: bump to 0.1.1

aria2: improve error message when aria2c is not found

  FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory

=>

  RuntimeError: aria2c(1) not found
version: bump to 0.1.2

aria2: disable certificate check

There has always been some problems with the mp4.48.cn cert. My local
browsers accept the cert, my brewed wget 1.19.4 can't verify the cert,
my brewed aria2 1.33.1 can, and aria2 1.19.0 on a ubuntu/xenial64 VM
can't... It's a mess. SSL Labs says the cert chain is incomplete and
gives it a B.[1] Let's just frigging disable the cert check and hope for
the best.

[1] https://www.ssllabs.com/ssltest/analyze.html?d=mp4.48.cn

version: bump to 0.1.5

setup.py: fix <py36 compat

Inadvertently used PEP 519 this whole time. Apparently no one gave a
shit.

config: fix directory not set in config situation

Set Config.directory to pwd, as described in the config
template. Another obvious yet no one gave a shit situation.

Drop py34 compat

Well, this was never 3.4 compatible (I was under the erroneous
impression that typing was available on 3.4). The peril of no testing
plus no one fucking cares.
Implement Docker-based integration testing on Travis

ci/script: increase caterpillar worker count

Travis builds are stupidly slow in the caterpillar download phase, possibly due
to low worker count.

version: bump to 0.2

Reformat with black

Forget about manual formatting.
setup.py: use Path.open()

aria2: write .aria2in in utf-8

Discovered bug on NT.

kvm48, peek: be more tolerant about failures...

when size of certain downloads cannot be determined. Do not fail over
OSError or requests.RequestException, and report total size of sizes we
can determine instead of nothing when some sizes are unknown.

config: handle NTFS invalid characters

Replace displayable characters with homographs (just FULLWIDTH
versions), and strip control characters.

THIS IS A BACKWARD-INCOMPATIBLE CHANGE.

aria2: do not use execvp on NT

It appears that a process cannot be replaced with execvp on Windows
NT (?); when execvp is called, a new process is spawned while the
original process simply completes it, and when you run the command in
console, you regain control over the console as soon as execvp is
called, which is apparently undesirable.

Also, aria2c is no longer called when there's nothing to download.
aria2: preserve timestamps with --remote-time=true
kvm48, config: introduce named_subdirs option
kvm48: relay aria2 exit status
kvm48: do not dump traceback on KeyboardInterrupt
config: normalize path separator on NT

kvm48: better report what's new

*Breaking change in stdout*: VODs not already downloaded are now marked
with an asterisk.

Also, improve reporting of the number of downloads and total download
size (only ones not already downloaded are included).

[WIP] introduce an experimental perf mode

The "perf" mode deals with performance VODs. (As opposed to the
classical "std" mode, also the default, which deals with VODs of
individual members.)

To be documented.

I really need a goddamn precommit hook.
Dockerfile: fix FFmpeg download URL
kvm48: add --dump-config-template option

config, kvm48: move nonempty check of names to std mode only

There's no reason to error out on an empty name list in perf mode. The
program only behaves like this because the check predates perf
mode (before it was even planned, to be precise).

config: normcase => normpath

I used the wrong function to normalize forward slashes on Windows (and
stops at that).
kvm48: print the list of downloaded files at the end

update: be smarter about when to print what's new

Do not print what's new when running a dev version, nor when the "new"
version is in fact a downgrade (e.g., from a newer beta/dev version to
stable).
